00098 class Mem_IStream: public Imf::IStream
00099 {
00100 public:
00101     
00102     Mem_IStream (unsigned char *exrbuf, size_t exrsize):
00103         IStream("dummy"), _exrpos (0), _exrsize(exrsize) { _exrbuf = exrbuf; }
00104     
00105     virtual bool    read (char c[], int n);
00106     virtual Int64   tellg ();
00107     virtual void    seekg (Int64 pos);
00108     virtual void    clear ();
00109     //virtual ~Mem_IStream() {}; // unused
00110     
00111 private:
00112 
00113     Int64 _exrpos;
00114     Int64 _exrsize;
00115     unsigned char *_exrbuf;
00116 };
00117 
00118 bool Mem_IStream::read (char c[], int n)
00119 {
00120     if (n + _exrpos <= _exrsize)
00121     {
00122         memcpy(c, (void *)(&_exrbuf[_exrpos]), n);
00123         _exrpos += n;
00124         return true;
00125     }
00126     else
00127         return false;
00128 }
00129 
00130 Int64 Mem_IStream::tellg ()
00131 {
00132     return _exrpos;
00133 }
00134 
00135 void Mem_IStream::seekg (Int64 pos)
00136 {
00137     _exrpos = pos;
00138 }
00139 
00140 void Mem_IStream::clear () 
00141 { 
00142 }

00144 struct _RGBAZ
00145 {
00146     half r;
00147     half g;
00148     half b;
00149     half a;
00150     half z;
00151 };
00152 
00153 typedef struct _RGBAZ RGBAZ;
00154 
00155 extern "C"
00156 {
00157     
00158 int imb_is_a_openexr(unsigned char *mem)
00159 {
00160     return Imf::isImfMagic ((const char *)mem);
00161 }
00162 
00163 static void openexr_header_compression(Header *header, int compression)
00164 {
00165     switch(compression)
00166     {
00167         case 0:
00168             header->compression() = NO_COMPRESSION;
00169             break;
00170         case 1:
00171             header->compression() = PXR24_COMPRESSION;
00172             break;
00173         case 2:
00174             header->compression() = ZIP_COMPRESSION;
00175             break;
00176         case 3:
00177             header->compression() = PIZ_COMPRESSION;
00178             break;
00179         case 4:
00180             header->compression() = RLE_COMPRESSION;
00181             break;
00182         default:
00183             header->compression() = ZIP_COMPRESSION;
00184             break; 
00185     }
00186 }
00187 
00188 static void openexr_header_metadata(Header *header, struct ImBuf *ibuf)
00189 {
00190     ImMetaData* info;
00191 
00192     for (info= ibuf->metadata; info; info= info->next)
00193         header->insert(info->key, StringAttribute(info->value));
00194 }
00195 
00196 static int imb_save_openexr_half(struct ImBuf *ibuf, const char *name, int flags)
00197 {
00198     int channels = ibuf->channels;
00199     int width = ibuf->x;
00200     int height = ibuf->y;
00201     int write_zbuf = (flags & IB_zbuffloat) && ibuf->zbuf_float != NULL;   // summarize
00202     
00203     try
00204     {
00205         Header header (width, height);
00206         
00207         openexr_header_compression(&header, ibuf->ftype & OPENEXR_COMPRESS);
00208         openexr_header_metadata(&header, ibuf);
00209         
00210         header.channels().insert ("R", Channel (HALF));
00211         header.channels().insert ("G", Channel (HALF));
00212         header.channels().insert ("B", Channel (HALF));
00213         if (ibuf->planes==32 && channels >= 4)
00214             header.channels().insert ("A", Channel (HALF));
00215         if (write_zbuf)     // z we do as float always
00216             header.channels().insert ("Z", Channel (Imf::FLOAT));
00217         
00218         FrameBuffer frameBuffer;            
00219         OutputFile *file = new OutputFile(name, header);            
00220         
00221         /* we store first everything in half array */
00222         RGBAZ *pixels = new RGBAZ[height * width];
00223         RGBAZ *to = pixels;
00224         int xstride= sizeof (RGBAZ);
00225         int ystride= xstride*width;
00226 
00227         /* indicate used buffers */
00228         frameBuffer.insert ("R", Slice (HALF,  (char *) &pixels[0].r, xstride, ystride));   
00229         frameBuffer.insert ("G", Slice (HALF,  (char *) &pixels[0].g, xstride, ystride));
00230         frameBuffer.insert ("B", Slice (HALF,  (char *) &pixels[0].b, xstride, ystride));
00231         if (ibuf->planes==32 && channels >= 4)
00232             frameBuffer.insert ("A", Slice (HALF, (char *) &pixels[0].a, xstride, ystride));
00233         if (write_zbuf)
00234             frameBuffer.insert ("Z", Slice (Imf::FLOAT, (char *)(ibuf->zbuf_float + (height-1)*width),
00235                                             sizeof(float), sizeof(float) * -width));
00236         if (ibuf->rect_float) {
00237             float *from;
00238 
00239             for (int i = ibuf->y-1; i >= 0; i--)
00240             {
00241                 from= ibuf->rect_float + channels*i*width;
00242 
00243                 for (int j = ibuf->x; j > 0; j--)
00244                 {
00245                     to->r = from[0];
00246                     to->g = from[1];
00247                     to->b = from[2];
00248                     to->a = (channels >= 4)? from[3]: 1.0f;
00249                     to++; from += 4;
00250                 }
00251             }
00252         }
00253         else {
00254             unsigned char *from;
00255 
00256             if (ibuf->profile == IB_PROFILE_LINEAR_RGB) {
00257                 for (int i = ibuf->y-1; i >= 0; i--)
00258                 {
00259                     from= (unsigned char *)ibuf->rect + channels*i*width;
00260 
00261                     for (int j = ibuf->x; j > 0; j--)
00262                     {
00263                         to->r = (float)(from[0])/255.0;
00264                         to->g = (float)(from[1])/255.0;
00265                         to->b = (float)(from[2])/255.0;
00266                         to->a = (float)(channels >= 4) ? from[3]/255.0 : 1.0f;
00267                         to++; from += 4;
00268                     }
00269                 }
00270             }
00271             else {
00272                 for (int i = ibuf->y-1; i >= 0; i--)
00273                 {
00274                     from= (unsigned char *)ibuf->rect + channels*i*width;
00275 
00276                     for (int j = ibuf->x; j > 0; j--)
00277                     {
00278                         to->r = srgb_to_linearrgb((float)from[0] / 255.0);
00279                         to->g = srgb_to_linearrgb((float)from[1] / 255.0);
00280                         to->b = srgb_to_linearrgb((float)from[2] / 255.0);
00281                         to->a = channels >= 4 ? (float)from[3]/255.0 : 1.0f;
00282                         to++; from += 4;
00283                     }
00284                 }
00285             }
00286         }
00287         
00288 //      printf("OpenEXR-save: Writing OpenEXR file of height %d.\n", height);
00289         
00290         file->setFrameBuffer (frameBuffer);               
00291         file->writePixels (height);                   
00292         delete file;
00293         delete [] pixels;
00294     }
00295     catch (const std::exception &exc)
00296     {
00297         printf("OpenEXR-save: ERROR: %s\n", exc.what());
00298         if (ibuf) IMB_freeImBuf(ibuf);
00299         
00300         return (0);
00301     }
00302     
00303     return (1);
00304 }
00305 
00306 static int imb_save_openexr_float(struct ImBuf *ibuf, const char *name, int flags)
00307 {
00308     int channels = ibuf->channels;
00309     int width = ibuf->x;
00310     int height = ibuf->y;
00311     int write_zbuf = (flags & IB_zbuffloat) && ibuf->zbuf_float != NULL;   // summarize
00312 
00313     try
00314     {
00315         Header header (width, height);
00316         
00317         openexr_header_compression(&header, ibuf->ftype & OPENEXR_COMPRESS);
00318         openexr_header_metadata(&header, ibuf);
00319         
00320         header.channels().insert ("R", Channel (Imf::FLOAT));
00321         header.channels().insert ("G", Channel (Imf::FLOAT));
00322         header.channels().insert ("B", Channel (Imf::FLOAT));
00323         if (ibuf->planes==32 && channels >= 4)
00324             header.channels().insert ("A", Channel (Imf::FLOAT));
00325         if (write_zbuf)
00326             header.channels().insert ("Z", Channel (Imf::FLOAT));
00327         
00328         FrameBuffer frameBuffer;            
00329         OutputFile *file = new OutputFile(name, header);            
00330         int xstride = sizeof(float) * channels;
00331         int ystride = - xstride*width;
00332         float *rect[4] = {NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL};
00333 
00334         /* last scanline, stride negative */
00335         rect[0]= ibuf->rect_float + channels*(height-1)*width;
00336         rect[1]= rect[0]+1;
00337         rect[2]= rect[0]+2;
00338         rect[3]= (channels >= 4)? rect[0]+3:rect[0]; /* red as alpha, is this needed since alpha isn't written? */
00339 
00340         frameBuffer.insert ("R", Slice (Imf::FLOAT,  (char *)rect[0], xstride, ystride));
00341         frameBuffer.insert ("G", Slice (Imf::FLOAT,  (char *)rect[1], xstride, ystride));
00342         frameBuffer.insert ("B", Slice (Imf::FLOAT,  (char *)rect[2], xstride, ystride));
00343         if (ibuf->planes==32 && channels >= 4)
00344             frameBuffer.insert ("A", Slice (Imf::FLOAT,  (char *)rect[3], xstride, ystride));
00345         if (write_zbuf)
00346             frameBuffer.insert ("Z", Slice (Imf::FLOAT, (char *) (ibuf->zbuf_float + (height-1)*width),
00347                                             sizeof(float), sizeof(float) * -width));
00348         file->setFrameBuffer (frameBuffer);               
00349         file->writePixels (height);                   
00350         delete file;
00351     }
00352     catch (const std::exception &exc)
00353     {
00354         printf("OpenEXR-save: ERROR: %s\n", exc.what());
00355         if (ibuf) IMB_freeImBuf(ibuf);
00356         
00357         return (0);
00358     }
00359     
00360     return (1);
00361     //  printf("OpenEXR-save: Done.\n");
00362 }
00363 
00364 
00365 int imb_save_openexr(struct ImBuf *ibuf, const char *name, int flags)
00366 {
00367     if (flags & IB_mem) 
00368     {
00369         printf("OpenEXR-save: Create EXR in memory CURRENTLY NOT SUPPORTED !\n");
00370         imb_addencodedbufferImBuf(ibuf);
00371         ibuf->encodedsize = 0;    
00372         return(0);
00373     } 
00374     
00375     if (ibuf->ftype & OPENEXR_HALF) 
00376         return imb_save_openexr_half(ibuf, name, flags);
00377     else {
00378         /* when no float rect, we save as half (16 bits is sufficient) */
00379         if (ibuf->rect_float==NULL)
00380             return imb_save_openexr_half(ibuf, name, flags);
00381         else
00382             return imb_save_openexr_float(ibuf, name, flags);
00383     }
00384 }
00385 
00386 /* ********************* Nicer API, MultiLayer and with Tile file support ************************************ */
00387 
00388 /* naming rules:
00389  * - parse name from right to left
00390  * - last character is channel ID, 1 char like 'A' 'R' 'G' 'B' 'X' 'Y' 'Z' 'W' 'U' 'V'
00391  * - separated with a dot; the Pass name (like "Depth", "Color", "Diffuse" or "Combined")
00392  * - separated with a dot: the Layer name (like "Lamp1" or "Walls" or "Characters")
00393  */
00394 
00395 static ListBase exrhandles= {NULL, NULL};
00396 
00397 typedef struct ExrHandle {
00398     struct ExrHandle *next, *prev;
00399     
00400     InputFile *ifile;
00401     TiledOutputFile *tofile;
00402     OutputFile *ofile;
00403     int tilex, tiley;
00404     int width, height;
00405     int mipmap;
00406     
00407     ListBase channels;  /* flattened out, ExrChannel */
00408     ListBase layers;    /* hierarchical, pointing in end to ExrChannel */
00409 } ExrHandle;
00410 
00411 /* flattened out channel */
00412 typedef struct ExrChannel {
00413     struct ExrChannel *next, *prev;
00414     
00415     char name[EXR_TOT_MAXNAME+1];   /* full name of layer+pass */
00416     int xstride, ystride;       /* step to next pixel, to next scanline */
00417     float *rect;                /* first pointer to write in */
00418     char chan_id;               /* quick lookup of channel char */
00419 } ExrChannel;
00420 
00421 
00422 /* hierarchical; layers -> passes -> channels[] */
00423 typedef struct ExrPass {
00424     struct ExrPass *next, *prev;
00425     char name[EXR_PASS_MAXNAME];
00426     int totchan;
00427     float *rect;
00428     struct ExrChannel *chan[EXR_PASS_MAXCHAN];
00429     char chan_id[EXR_PASS_MAXCHAN];
00430 } ExrPass;
00431 
00432 typedef struct ExrLayer {
00433     struct ExrLayer *next, *prev;
00434     char name[EXR_LAY_MAXNAME+1];
00435     ListBase passes;
00436 } ExrLayer;
00437 
00438 /* ********************** */
00439 
00440 void *IMB_exr_get_handle(void)
00441 {
00442     ExrHandle *data= (ExrHandle *)MEM_callocN(sizeof(ExrHandle), "exr handle");
00443     BLI_addtail(&exrhandles, data);
00444     return data;
00445 }
00446 
00447 /* adds flattened ExrChannels */
00448 /* xstride, ystride and rect can be done in set_channel too, for tile writing */
00449 void IMB_exr_add_channel(void *handle, const char *layname, const char *passname, int xstride, int ystride, float *rect)
00450 {
00451     ExrHandle *data= (ExrHandle *)handle;
00452     ExrChannel *echan;
00453     
00454     echan= (ExrChannel *)MEM_callocN(sizeof(ExrChannel), "exr tile channel");
00455     
00456     if (layname) {
00457         char lay[EXR_LAY_MAXNAME+1], pass[EXR_PASS_MAXNAME+1];
00458         BLI_strncpy(lay, layname, EXR_LAY_MAXNAME);
00459         BLI_strncpy(pass, passname, EXR_PASS_MAXNAME);
00460 
00461         sprintf(echan->name, "%s.%s", lay, pass);
00462     }
00463     else
00464         BLI_strncpy(echan->name, passname, EXR_TOT_MAXNAME-1);
00465     
00466     echan->xstride= xstride;
00467     echan->ystride= ystride;
00468     echan->rect= rect;
00469     
00470     // printf("added channel %s\n", echan->name);
00471     BLI_addtail(&data->channels, echan);
00472 }
00473 
00474 /* only used for writing temp. render results (not image files) */
00475 int IMB_exr_begin_write(void *handle, const char *filename, int width, int height, int compress)
00476 {
00477     ExrHandle *data= (ExrHandle *)handle;
00478     Header header (width, height);
00479     ExrChannel *echan;
00480     
00481     data->width= width;
00482     data->height= height;
00483     
00484     for (echan= (ExrChannel *)data->channels.first; echan; echan= echan->next)
00485         header.channels().insert (echan->name, Channel (Imf::FLOAT));
00486     
00487     openexr_header_compression(&header, compress);
00488     // openexr_header_metadata(&header, ibuf); // no imbuf. cant write
00489     /* header.lineOrder() = DECREASING_Y; this crashes in windows for file read! */
00490     
00491     header.insert ("BlenderMultiChannel", StringAttribute ("Blender V2.55.1 and newer"));
00492 
00493     /* avoid crash/abort when we don't have permission to write here */
00494     try {
00495         data->ofile = new OutputFile(filename, header);
00496     }
00497     catch (const std::exception &exc) {
00498         std::cerr << "IMB_exr_begin_write: ERROR: " << exc.what() << std::endl;
00499         data->ofile = NULL;
00500     }
00501 
00502     return (data->ofile != NULL);
00503 }
00504 
00505 void IMB_exrtile_begin_write(void *handle, const char *filename, int mipmap, int width, int height, int tilex, int tiley)
00506 {
00507     ExrHandle *data= (ExrHandle *)handle;
00508     Header header (width, height);
00509     ExrChannel *echan;
00510     
00511     data->tilex= tilex;
00512     data->tiley= tiley;
00513     data->width= width;
00514     data->height= height;
00515     data->mipmap= mipmap;
00516     
00517     for (echan= (ExrChannel *)data->channels.first; echan; echan= echan->next)
00518         header.channels().insert (echan->name, Channel (Imf::FLOAT));
00519     
00520     header.setTileDescription (TileDescription (tilex, tiley, (mipmap)? MIPMAP_LEVELS: ONE_LEVEL));
00521     header.lineOrder() = RANDOM_Y;
00522     header.compression() = RLE_COMPRESSION;
00523     
00524     header.insert ("BlenderMultiChannel", StringAttribute ("Blender V2.43"));
00525     
00526     data->tofile = new TiledOutputFile(filename, header);
00527 }
00528 
00529 /* read from file */
00530 int IMB_exr_begin_read(void *handle, const char *filename, int *width, int *height)
00531 {
00532     ExrHandle *data= (ExrHandle *)handle;
00533     
00534     if (BLI_exists(filename) && BLI_file_size(filename)>32) {   /* 32 is arbitrary, but zero length files crashes exr */
00535         data->ifile = new InputFile(filename);
00536         if (data->ifile) {
00537             Box2i dw = data->ifile->header().dataWindow();
00538             data->width= *width  = dw.max.x - dw.min.x + 1;
00539             data->height= *height = dw.max.y - dw.min.y + 1;
00540             
00541             const ChannelList &channels = data->ifile->header().channels();
00542             
00543             for (ChannelList::ConstIterator i = channels.begin(); i != channels.end(); ++i)
00544                 IMB_exr_add_channel(data, NULL, i.name(), 0, 0, NULL);
00545             
00546             return 1;
00547         }
00548     }
00549     return 0;
00550 }
00551 
00552 /* still clumsy name handling, layers/channels can be ordered as list in list later */
00553 void IMB_exr_set_channel(void *handle, const char *layname, const char *passname, int xstride, int ystride, float *rect)
00554 {
00555     ExrHandle *data= (ExrHandle *)handle;
00556     ExrChannel *echan;
00557     char name[EXR_TOT_MAXNAME + 1];
00558     
00559     if (layname) {
00560         char lay[EXR_LAY_MAXNAME+1], pass[EXR_PASS_MAXNAME+1];
00561         BLI_strncpy(lay, layname, EXR_LAY_MAXNAME);
00562         BLI_strncpy(pass, passname, EXR_PASS_MAXNAME);
00563         
00564         sprintf(name, "%s.%s", lay, pass);
00565     }
00566     else
00567         BLI_strncpy(name, passname, EXR_TOT_MAXNAME-1);
00568 
00569     echan= (ExrChannel *)BLI_findstring(&data->channels, name, offsetof(ExrChannel, name));
00570 
00571     if (echan) {
00572         echan->xstride= xstride;
00573         echan->ystride= ystride;
00574         echan->rect= rect;
00575     }
00576     else
00577         printf("IMB_exrtile_set_channel error %s\n", name);
00578 }
00579 
00580 void IMB_exrtile_clear_channels(void *handle)
00581 {
00582     ExrHandle *data= (ExrHandle *)handle;
00583     BLI_freelistN(&data->channels);
00584 }
00585 
00586 void IMB_exrtile_write_channels(void *handle, int partx, int party, int level)
00587 {
00588     ExrHandle *data= (ExrHandle *)handle;
00589     FrameBuffer frameBuffer;
00590     ExrChannel *echan;
00591     
00592     for (echan= (ExrChannel *)data->channels.first; echan; echan= echan->next) {
00593         float *rect= echan->rect - echan->xstride*partx - echan->ystride*party;
00594 
00595         frameBuffer.insert (echan->name, Slice (Imf::FLOAT,  (char *)rect,
00596                             echan->xstride*sizeof(float), echan->ystride*sizeof(float)));
00597     }
00598     
00599     data->tofile->setFrameBuffer (frameBuffer);
00600 
00601     try {
00602         // printf("write tile %d %d\n", partx/data->tilex, party/data->tiley);
00603         data->tofile->writeTile (partx/data->tilex, party/data->tiley, level);
00604     }
00605     catch (const std::exception &exc) {
00606         std::cerr << "OpenEXR-writeTile: ERROR: " << exc.what() << std::endl;
00607     }
00608 }
00609 
00610 void IMB_exr_write_channels(void *handle)
00611 {
00612     ExrHandle *data= (ExrHandle *)handle;
00613     FrameBuffer frameBuffer;
00614     ExrChannel *echan;
00615     
00616     if (data->channels.first) {
00617         for (echan= (ExrChannel *)data->channels.first; echan; echan= echan->next) {
00618             /* last scanline, stride negative */
00619             float *rect = echan->rect + echan->xstride*(data->height-1)*data->width;
00620             
00621             frameBuffer.insert (echan->name, Slice (Imf::FLOAT,  (char *)rect,
00622                                                     echan->xstride*sizeof(float), -echan->ystride*sizeof(float)));
00623         }
00624         
00625         data->ofile->setFrameBuffer (frameBuffer);
00626         try {
00627             data->ofile->writePixels (data->height);    
00628         }
00629         catch (const std::exception &exc) {
00630             std::cerr << "OpenEXR-writePixels: ERROR: " << exc.what() << std::endl;
00631         }
00632     }
00633     else {
00634         printf("Error: attempt to save MultiLayer without layers.\n");
00635     }
00636 }
00637 
00638 void IMB_exr_read_channels(void *handle)
00639 {
00640     ExrHandle *data= (ExrHandle *)handle;
00641     FrameBuffer frameBuffer;
00642     ExrChannel *echan;
00643     
00644     /* check if exr was saved with previous versions of blender which flipped images */
00645     const StringAttribute *ta = data->ifile->header().findTypedAttribute <StringAttribute> ("BlenderMultiChannel");
00646     short flip = (ta && strncmp(ta->value().c_str(), "Blender V2.43", 13)==0); /* 'previous multilayer attribute, flipped */
00647     
00648     for (echan= (ExrChannel *)data->channels.first; echan; echan= echan->next) {
00649         
00650         if (echan->rect) {
00651             if (flip)
00652                 frameBuffer.insert (echan->name, Slice (Imf::FLOAT,  (char *)echan->rect,
00653                                             echan->xstride*sizeof(float), echan->ystride*sizeof(float)));
00654             else
00655                 frameBuffer.insert (echan->name, Slice (Imf::FLOAT,  (char *)(echan->rect + echan->xstride*(data->height-1)*data->width),
00656                                             echan->xstride*sizeof(float), -echan->ystride*sizeof(float)));
00657         }
00658         else 
00659             printf("warning, channel with no rect set %s\n", echan->name);
00660     }
00661     
00662     data->ifile->setFrameBuffer (frameBuffer);
00663 
00664     try {
00665         data->ifile->readPixels (0, data->height-1);    
00666     }
00667     catch (const std::exception &exc) {
00668         std::cerr << "OpenEXR-readPixels: ERROR: " << exc.what() << std::endl;
00669     }
00670 }
00671 
00672 void IMB_exr_multilayer_convert(void *handle, void *base,  
00673                                 void * (*addlayer)(void *base, char *str), 
00674                                 void (*addpass)(void *base, void *lay, char *str, 
00675                                                 float *rect, int totchan, char *chan_id))
00676 {
00677     ExrHandle *data= (ExrHandle *)handle;
00678     ExrLayer *lay;
00679     ExrPass *pass;
00680 
00681     if (data->layers.first==NULL) {
00682         printf("cannot convert multilayer, no layers in handle\n");
00683         return;
00684     }
00685 
00686     for (lay= (ExrLayer *)data->layers.first; lay; lay= lay->next) {
00687         void *laybase= addlayer(base, lay->name);
00688         if (laybase) {
00689             for (pass= (ExrPass *)lay->passes.first; pass; pass= pass->next) {
00690                 addpass(base, laybase, pass->name, pass->rect, pass->totchan, pass->chan_id);
00691                 pass->rect= NULL;
00692             }
00693         }
00694     }
00695 }
00696 
00697 
00698 void IMB_exr_close(void *handle)
00699 {
00700     ExrHandle *data= (ExrHandle *)handle;
00701     ExrLayer *lay;
00702     ExrPass *pass;
00703     
00704     if (data->ifile)
00705         delete data->ifile;
00706     else if (data->ofile)
00707         delete data->ofile;
00708     else if (data->tofile)
00709         delete data->tofile;
00710     
00711     data->ifile= NULL;
00712     data->ofile= NULL;
00713     data->tofile= NULL;
00714     
00715     BLI_freelistN(&data->channels);
00716     
00717     for (lay= (ExrLayer *)data->layers.first; lay; lay= lay->next) {
00718         for (pass= (ExrPass *)lay->passes.first; pass; pass= pass->next)
00719             if (pass->rect)
00720                 MEM_freeN(pass->rect);
00721         BLI_freelistN(&lay->passes);
00722     }
00723     BLI_freelistN(&data->layers);
00724     
00725     BLI_remlink(&exrhandles, data);
00726     MEM_freeN(data);
00727 }
00728 
00729 /* ********* */
00730 
00731 static int imb_exr_split_channel_name(ExrChannel *echan, char *layname, char *passname)
00732 {
00733     int plen, len= strlen(echan->name);
00734     
00735     if (len < 4) {
00736         printf("multilayer read: name too short: %s\n", echan->name);
00737         return 0;
00738     }
00739     if (echan->name[len-2]!='.') {
00740         printf("multilayer read: name has no Channel: %s\n", echan->name);
00741         return 0;
00742     }
00743     echan->chan_id= echan->name[len-1];
00744     
00745     len-= 3;
00746     while(len>=0) {
00747         if (echan->name[len]=='.')
00748             break;
00749         len--;
00750     }
00751     BLI_strncpy(passname, echan->name+len+1, EXR_PASS_MAXNAME);
00752     plen= strlen(passname);
00753     if (plen < 3) {
00754         printf("multilayer read: should not happen: %s\n", echan->name);
00755         return 0;
00756     }
00757     passname[plen-2]= 0;
00758     
00759     if (len<1)
00760         layname[0]= 0;
00761     else {
00762         BLI_strncpy(layname, echan->name, EXR_LAY_MAXNAME);
00763         layname[len]= 0;
00764     }
00765     // printf("found lay %s pass %s chan %c\n", layname, passname, echan->chan_id);
00766     return 1;
00767 }
00768 
00769 static ExrLayer *imb_exr_get_layer(ListBase *lb, char *layname)
00770 {
00771     ExrLayer *lay= (ExrLayer *)BLI_findstring(lb, layname, offsetof(ExrLayer, name));
00772 
00773     if (lay==NULL) {
00774         lay= (ExrLayer *)MEM_callocN(sizeof(ExrLayer), "exr layer");
00775         BLI_addtail(lb, lay);
00776         BLI_strncpy(lay->name, layname, EXR_LAY_MAXNAME);
00777     }
00778 
00779     return lay;
00780 }
00781 
00782 static ExrPass *imb_exr_get_pass(ListBase *lb, char *passname)
00783 {
00784     ExrPass *pass= (ExrPass *)BLI_findstring(lb, passname, offsetof(ExrPass, name));
00785     
00786     if (pass==NULL) {
00787         pass= (ExrPass *)MEM_callocN(sizeof(ExrPass), "exr pass");
00788 
00789         if (strcmp(passname, "Combined")==0)
00790             BLI_addhead(lb, pass);
00791         else
00792             BLI_addtail(lb, pass);
00793     }
00794 
00795     BLI_strncpy(pass->name, passname, EXR_LAY_MAXNAME);
00796     
00797     return pass;
00798 }
00799 
00800 /* creates channels, makes a hierarchy and assigns memory to channels */
00801 static ExrHandle *imb_exr_begin_read_mem(InputFile *file, int width, int height)
00802 {
00803     ExrLayer *lay;
00804     ExrPass *pass;
00805     ExrChannel *echan;
00806     ExrHandle *data= (ExrHandle *)IMB_exr_get_handle();
00807     int a;
00808     char layname[EXR_TOT_MAXNAME], passname[EXR_TOT_MAXNAME];
00809     
00810     data->ifile= file;
00811     data->width= width;
00812     data->height= height;
00813     
00814     const ChannelList &channels = data->ifile->header().channels();
00815 
00816     for (ChannelList::ConstIterator i = channels.begin(); i != channels.end(); ++i)
00817         IMB_exr_add_channel(data, NULL, i.name(), 0, 0, NULL);
00818     
00819     /* now try to sort out how to assign memory to the channels */
00820     /* first build hierarchical layer list */
00821     for (echan= (ExrChannel *)data->channels.first; echan; echan= echan->next) {
00822         if ( imb_exr_split_channel_name(echan, layname, passname) ) {
00823             ExrLayer *lay= imb_exr_get_layer(&data->layers, layname);
00824             ExrPass *pass= imb_exr_get_pass(&lay->passes, passname);
00825             
00826             pass->chan[pass->totchan]= echan;
00827             pass->totchan++;
00828             if (pass->totchan>=EXR_PASS_MAXCHAN)
00829                 break;
00830         }
00831     }
00832     if (echan) {
00833         printf("error, too many channels in one pass: %s\n", echan->name);
00834         IMB_exr_close(data);
00835         return NULL;
00836     }
00837     
00838     /* with some heuristics, try to merge the channels in buffers */
00839     for (lay= (ExrLayer *)data->layers.first; lay; lay= lay->next) {
00840         for (pass= (ExrPass *)lay->passes.first; pass; pass= pass->next) {
00841             if (pass->totchan) {
00842                 pass->rect= (float *)MEM_mapallocN(width*height*pass->totchan*sizeof(float), "pass rect");
00843                 if (pass->totchan==1) {
00844                     echan= pass->chan[0];
00845                     echan->rect= pass->rect;
00846                     echan->xstride= 1;
00847                     echan->ystride= width;
00848                     pass->chan_id[0]= echan->chan_id;
00849                 }
00850                 else {
00851                     char lookup[256];
00852                     
00853                     memset(lookup, 0, sizeof(lookup));
00854                            
00855                     /* we can have RGB(A), XYZ(W), UVA */
00856                     if (pass->totchan==3 || pass->totchan==4) {
00857                         if (pass->chan[0]->chan_id=='B' || pass->chan[1]->chan_id=='B' ||  pass->chan[2]->chan_id=='B') {
00858                             lookup[(unsigned int)'R']= 0;
00859                             lookup[(unsigned int)'G']= 1;
00860                             lookup[(unsigned int)'B']= 2;
00861                             lookup[(unsigned int)'A']= 3;
00862                         }
00863                         else if (pass->chan[0]->chan_id=='Y' || pass->chan[1]->chan_id=='Y' ||  pass->chan[2]->chan_id=='Y') {
00864                             lookup[(unsigned int)'X']= 0;
00865                             lookup[(unsigned int)'Y']= 1;
00866                             lookup[(unsigned int)'Z']= 2;
00867                             lookup[(unsigned int)'W']= 3;
00868                         }
00869                         else {
00870                             lookup[(unsigned int)'U']= 0;
00871                             lookup[(unsigned int)'V']= 1;
00872                             lookup[(unsigned int)'A']= 2;
00873                         }
00874                         for (a=0; a<pass->totchan; a++) {
00875                             echan= pass->chan[a];
00876                             echan->rect= pass->rect + lookup[(unsigned int)echan->chan_id];
00877                             echan->xstride= pass->totchan;
00878                             echan->ystride= width*pass->totchan;
00879                             pass->chan_id[ (unsigned int)lookup[(unsigned int)echan->chan_id] ]= echan->chan_id;
00880                         }
00881                     }
00882                     else { /* unknown */
00883                         for (a=0; a<pass->totchan; a++) {
00884                             echan= pass->chan[a];
00885                             echan->rect= pass->rect + a;
00886                             echan->xstride= pass->totchan;
00887                             echan->ystride= width*pass->totchan;
00888                             pass->chan_id[a]= echan->chan_id;
00889                         }
00890                     }
00891                 }
00892             }
00893         }
00894     }
00895     
00896     return data;
00897 }
00898

00900 /* ********************************************************* */
00901 
00902 typedef struct RGBA
00903 {
00904     float r;
00905     float g;
00906     float b;
00907     float a;
00908 } RGBA;
00909 
00910 
00911 /* debug only */
00912 static void exr_print_filecontents(InputFile *file)
00913 {
00914     const ChannelList &channels = file->header().channels();
00915     
00916     for (ChannelList::ConstIterator i = channels.begin(); i != channels.end(); ++i)
00917     {
00918         const Channel &channel = i.channel();
00919         printf("OpenEXR-load: Found channel %s of type %d\n", i.name(), channel.type);
00920     }
00921 }
00922 
00923 /* for non-multilayer, map  R G B A channel names to something that's in this file */
00924 static const char *exr_rgba_channelname(InputFile *file, const char *chan)
00925 {
00926     const ChannelList &channels = file->header().channels();
00927     
00928     for (ChannelList::ConstIterator i = channels.begin(); i != channels.end(); ++i)
00929     {
00930         /* const Channel &channel = i.channel(); */ /* Not used yet */
00931         const char *str= i.name();
00932         int len= strlen(str);
00933         if (len) {
00934             if (BLI_strcasecmp(chan, str+len-1)==0) {
00935                 return str;
00936             }
00937         }
00938     }
00939     return chan;
00940 }
00941 
00942 
00943 
00944 static int exr_has_zbuffer(InputFile *file)
00945 {
00946     return !(file->header().channels().findChannel("Z") == NULL);
00947 }
00948 
00949 static int exr_is_multilayer(InputFile *file)
00950 {
00951     const StringAttribute *comments= file->header().findTypedAttribute<StringAttribute>("BlenderMultiChannel");
00952     const ChannelList &channels = file->header().channels();
00953     std::set <std::string> layerNames;
00954 
00955     channels.layers(layerNames);
00956 
00957     if (comments || layerNames.size()>1)
00958             return 1;
00959 
00960     return 0;
00961 }
00962 
00963 struct ImBuf *imb_load_openexr(unsigned char *mem, size_t size, int flags)
00964 {
00965     struct ImBuf *ibuf = NULL;
00966     InputFile *file = NULL;
00967     
00968     if (imb_is_a_openexr(mem) == 0) return(NULL);
00969     
00970     try
00971     {
00972         Mem_IStream *membuf = new Mem_IStream(mem, size); 
00973         int is_multi;
00974         file = new InputFile(*membuf);
00975         
00976         Box2i dw = file->header().dataWindow();
00977         int width  = dw.max.x - dw.min.x + 1;
00978         int height = dw.max.y - dw.min.y + 1;
00979         
00980         //printf("OpenEXR-load: image data window %d %d %d %d\n", 
00981         //     dw.min.x, dw.min.y, dw.max.x, dw.max.y);
00982 
00983         if (0) // debug
00984             exr_print_filecontents(file);
00985         
00986         is_multi= exr_is_multilayer(file);
00987         
00988         /* do not make an ibuf when */
00989         if (is_multi && !(flags & IB_test) && !(flags & IB_multilayer)) 
00990         {
00991             printf("Error: can't process EXR multilayer file\n");
00992         }
00993         else {
00994         
00995             ibuf = IMB_allocImBuf(width, height, 32, 0);
00996             ibuf->ftype = OPENEXR;
00997 
00998             /* openEXR is linear as per EXR spec */
00999             ibuf->profile = IB_PROFILE_LINEAR_RGB;
01000             
01001             if (!(flags & IB_test))
01002             {
01003                 if (is_multi) /* only enters with IB_multilayer flag set */
01004                 {
01005                     /* constructs channels for reading, allocates memory in channels */
01006                     ExrHandle *handle= imb_exr_begin_read_mem(file, width, height);
01007                     if (handle) {
01008                         IMB_exr_read_channels(handle);
01009                         ibuf->userdata= handle;         /* potential danger, the caller has to check for this! */
01010                     }
01011                 }
01012                 else {
01013                     FrameBuffer frameBuffer;
01014                     float *first;
01015                     int xstride = sizeof(float) * 4;
01016                     int ystride = - xstride*width;
01017                     
01018                     imb_addrectfloatImBuf(ibuf);
01019                     
01020                     /* inverse correct first pixel for datawindow coordinates (- dw.min.y because of y flip) */
01021                     first= ibuf->rect_float - 4*(dw.min.x - dw.min.y*width);
01022                     /* but, since we read y-flipped (negative y stride) we move to last scanline */
01023                     first+= 4*(height-1)*width;
01024                     
01025                     frameBuffer.insert ( exr_rgba_channelname(file, "R"), 
01026                                         Slice (Imf::FLOAT,  (char *) first, xstride, ystride));
01027                     frameBuffer.insert ( exr_rgba_channelname(file, "G"), 
01028                                         Slice (Imf::FLOAT,  (char *) (first+1), xstride, ystride));
01029                     frameBuffer.insert ( exr_rgba_channelname(file, "B"), 
01030                                         Slice (Imf::FLOAT,  (char *) (first+2), xstride, ystride));
01031                                                                             
01032                     frameBuffer.insert ( exr_rgba_channelname(file, "A"), 
01033                                         Slice (Imf::FLOAT,  (char *) (first+3), xstride, ystride, 1, 1, 1.0f)); /* 1.0 is fill value */
01034 
01035                     if (exr_has_zbuffer(file)) 
01036                     {
01037                         float *firstz;
01038                         
01039                         addzbuffloatImBuf(ibuf);
01040                         firstz= ibuf->zbuf_float - (dw.min.x - dw.min.y*width);
01041                         firstz+= (height-1)*width;
01042                         frameBuffer.insert ("Z", Slice (Imf::FLOAT,  (char *)firstz , sizeof(float), -width*sizeof(float)));
01043                     }
01044                     
01045                     file->setFrameBuffer (frameBuffer);
01046                     file->readPixels (dw.min.y, dw.max.y);
01047 
01048                     // XXX, ImBuf has no nice way to deal with this.
01049                     // ideally IM_rect would be used when the caller wants a rect BUT
01050                     // at the moment all functions use IM_rect.
01051                     // Disabling this is ok because all functions should check if a rect exists and create one on demand.
01052                     //
01053                     // Disabling this because the sequencer frees immediate.
01054                     //
01055                     // if (flag & IM_rect)
01056                     //     IMB_rect_from_float(ibuf);
01057                     
01058                     /* file is no longer needed */
01059                     delete file;
01060                 }
01061             }
01062         }
01063         return(ibuf);
01064     }
01065     catch (const std::exception &exc)
01066     {
01067         std::cerr << exc.what() << std::endl;
01068         if (ibuf) IMB_freeImBuf(ibuf);
01069         delete file;
01070         
01071         return (0);
01072     }
01073     
01074 }
01075 
01076 void imb_initopenexr(void)
01077 {
01078     int num_threads = BLI_system_thread_count();
01079 
01080     setGlobalThreadCount(num_threads);
01081 }
